app\\layout.tsx.name: layout.tsx
app\\layout.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Defines the application's root layout structure, metadata, and global font configurations. It serves as the primary entry point wrapper for all pages while importing required global CSS styles.

app\\page.tsx.name: page.tsx
app\\page.tsx.upperLevelSummary: Defines the home page component that renders a calculator interface within a centered layout. Serves as the main entry point for the application and depends on the Calculator and Visualizer components.

components\\Button.tsx.name: Button.tsx
components\\Button.tsx.upperLevelSummary: This component provides a customizable calculator button with support for multiple visual variants and click handling. It relies on local CSS modules for styling and is primarily utilized by the ButtonGrid component to build the user interface.

components\\ButtonGrid.tsx.name: ButtonGrid.tsx

metadata.firstNLines:
import Button from "./Button";
import styles from "./ButtonGrid.module.css";

interface ButtonGridProps {
    onButtonClick: (value: string) => void;
}

/**
 * Calculator button grid component
 * Arranges buttons in a 4x5 grid layout
 */
export default function ButtonGrid({ onButtonClick }: ButtonGridProps) {
    const buttons = [
        { value: "C", variant: "special" as const },
        { value: "±", variant: "special" as const },
        { value: "%", variant: "special" as const },
        { value: "÷", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "7", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "8", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "9", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "×", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "4", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "5", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "6", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "-", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "1", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "2", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "3", variant: "number" as const },
        { value: "+", variant: "operator" as const },
        { value: "0", variant: "number" as const, wide: true },

components\\ButtonGrid.tsx.upperLevelSummary: This component renders a 4x5 grid of calculator buttons and manages click interactions via a provided callback function. It depends on the Button component and local styles to supply interactive elements to the parent Calculator container.

components\\Calculator.tsx.name: Calculator.tsx
components\\Calculator.tsx.upperLevelSummary: This component manages the state and logic for a functional calculator interface. It coordinates display and input subcomponents while utilizing a shared utility library for mathematical operations.

components\\Display.tsx.name: Display.tsx
components\\Display.tsx.upperLevelSummary: This component renders the calculator's display interface to show current input values and operation history. It is utilized by the Calculator component and depends on a local CSS module for styling.

eslint.config.mjs.name: eslint.config.mjs
eslint.config.mjs.upperLevelSummary: Configures project-wide linting by merging Next.js core vitals and TypeScript presets with custom global ignore paths. Exports the central eslintConfig object and depends on external Next.js configuration packages for its rule sets.

lib\\calculator.ts.name: calculator.ts

metadata.fileDocstring:

 * Contains pure mathematical functions for calculator operations

lib\\calculator.ts.upperLevelSummary: Provides core calculator logic through pure mathematical functions, input parsing, and result formatting. Functions as an independent utility module with no internal dependencies or external consumers.

next-env.d.ts.name: next-env.d.ts
next-env.d.ts.upperLevelSummary: Provides global TypeScript type definitions for Next.js core features, image types, and route declarations. Acts as an automatically managed configuration file that integrates framework-specific types into the project environment.

next.config.ts.name: next.config.ts
next.config.ts.upperLevelSummary: Defines framework-level configuration options and settings to customize the Next.js application. It exports a standalone configuration object that operates independently without local dependencies or internal dependents.

This is a [Next.js](https://nextjs.org) project bootstrapped with [`create-next-app`](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/cli/create-next-app).

## Getting Started

First, run the development server:

```bash
npm run dev
# or
yarn dev
# or
pnpm dev
# or
bun dev
```

Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) with your browser to see the result.

You can start editing the page by modifying `app/page.tsx`. The page auto-updates as you edit the file.

This project uses [`next/font`](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/building-your-application/optimizing/fonts) to automatically optimize and load [Geist](https://vercel.com/font), a new font family for Vercel.

## Learn More

To learn more about Next.js, take a look at the following resources:

- [Next.js Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs) - learn about Next.js features and API.
- [Learn Next.js](https://nextjs.org/learn) - an interactive Next.js tutorial.

You can check out [the Next.js GitHub repository](https://github.com/vercel/next.js) - your feedback and contributions are welcome!
